text: Flydubai is a low-cost airline based in Dubai, United Arab Emirates."سياسة الخصوصية." flydubai. Retrieved on August 10, 2011. It was established by the government of Dubai in July 2008. Although not part of The Emirates Group, Flydubai received support from Emirates during its initial establishment. The airline operates from Dubai International Airport and serves 114 destinations in the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and Europe. Flydubai started its operations in June 2009 with flights to Beirut and Amman, and it has since expanded its route network."Budget Carrier FlyDubai In Talks For 50 Aircraft Order." Reuters. Retrieved on June 27, 2013."FlyDubai Considers 50 New Aircraft." Gulf News. Retrieved on June 27, 2013. In 2020, Flydubai faced losses due to the grounding of Boeing's Max 737 aircraft worldwide. == References == Category:Airlines Category:Organizations based in the United Arab Emirates
title: Flydubai
